i peter.gloss: the first New Testament book traditionally attributed to Saint Peter the Apostle

ip.gloss: the sciences concerned with gathering, manipulating, storing, retrieving, and classifying recorded information

ipidae.gloss: large family of bark-boring or wood-boring short-beaked beetles

ipo.gloss: a corporation's first offer to sell stock to the public

ipomoea alba.gloss: pantropical climber having white fragrant nocturnal flowers

ipomoea batatas.gloss: pantropical vine widely cultivated in several varieties for its large sweet tuberous root with orange flesh

ipomoea fastigiata.gloss: tropical American prostrate or climbing herbaceous perennial having an enormous starchy root

ipomoea leptophylla.gloss: a morning glory with long roots of western United States

ipomoea nil.gloss: annual Old World tropical climbing herb distinguished by wide color range and frilled or double flowers

ipomoea panurata.gloss: tropical American prostrate or climbing herbaceous perennial having an enormous starchy root

ipomoea pes-caprae.gloss: a prostrate perennial of coastal sand dunes Florida to Texas

ipomoea purpurea.gloss: pantropical annual climbing herb with funnel-shaped blue, purple, pink or white flowers

ipomoea quamoclit.gloss: tropical American annual climber having red (sometimes white) flowers and finely dissected leaves

ipomoea tricolor.gloss: annual or perennial climbing herb of Central America having sky-blue flowers

ipsus.gloss: a battle between the successors of Alexander the Great (301 BC)

ipv.gloss: a poliovirus vaccine consisting of inactivated polio virus that is injected subcutaneously to provide immunity to poliomyelitis
